Derive a package data field

Source: R/generic_pkg_data_derive.R
pkg_data_derive.Rd

Derive a pkg data field, giving a function by which a piece of package data is calculated. This function is not called directly, it used by the indexing functions implemented for pkg to populate new data fields. Default implementations accept field as a character, automatically dispatching on the field as a class object, and accept a missing resource, instead iterating through pkg resources by priority.

Usage

pkg_data_derive(pkg, resource, field, ...)

Arguments

pkg

A pkg()

resource

A resource(), or if not provided, the resource extracted from pkg@resource.

field

Used for dispatching on which field to derive. Methods are provided such that a simple character field name can be passed and used to build a class for dispatching to the right derivation function.

...

Used by specific methods.

Value

The derived field value.

Details

This function is used internally when accessing a pkg object using $, [[ and [.

See also

Other generics: pkg_data_info()
